medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was born with microphallus (<1 cm) and bilateral cryptorchidism. At 2 months, biochemical evaluation revealed low testosterone levels. Between 11 years 8 months and 17 years 3 months, the boy demonstrated significant increases in testicular volume and hormonal levels indicative of puberty.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient underwent orchidopexy for cryptorchidism and testosterone treatment for microphallus at various ages. He had an atrial septal defect, which was surgically corrected at 10 years.
medical_history.family_history: Both unaffected parents carried a heterozygous KISS1R mutation.
